summary: The Financial Report of the U.S. Government provides a comprehensive view of government finances, including revenues, costs, assets, liabilities, long-term sustainability, and the financial impact of the federal COVID-19 response. We audit the financial statements in that report each year, but we haven't yet been able to determine if they fairly present the government's finances. title: Financial Audit: FY 2021 and FY 2020 Consolidated Financial Statements of the U.S. Government
